title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: Introduction
content: Chronic Hand Dermatitis (CHD) is one of the most persistent and misdiagnosed skin conditions worldwide.

title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: Symptoms
content: It often appears as redness, scaling, itching, and painful cracks on the hands.

title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: The Mystery
content: CHD shares visual and symptomatic similarities with many other skin conditions such as eczema, psoriasis, or allergic reactions, making diagnosis challenging.

title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: Fungal Infections
content: Studies have shown that in up to 38% of cases, what appears to be dermatitis is actually a fungal infection.

title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: Misuse of Corticosteroids
content: Unfortunately, the misuse of corticosteroids (intended for eczema) can worsen fungal problems.

title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: Clinical Perspective
content: Dermatologists emphasize that accurate diagnosis is key. Without proper fungal cultures, KOH tests, or skin biopsies, it's nearly impossible to distinguish CHD from other mimicking conditions.

title: Chronic Hand Dermatitis: Call for Awareness
content: Understanding the true nature of CHD is the first step toward healing.
